Methods¶

Loss Functions¶

Loss functions used in OOD/OSR, implemented as torch.nn.Module.

ConfidenceLoss¶

class oodtk.criterion.ConfidenceLoss(lmbda=1.0, eps=1e-24)¶

Loss proposed in Learning Confidence for Out-of-Distribution Detection in Neural Networks. The models learns to predict a confidence \(c\) in addition to the class membership.

The loss minimized the Negative Log Likelihood for class membership prediction.

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\mathcal{L}_{NLL} + \lambda \mathcal{L}_c = - \sum_{i=1}^{M} log(p'_{i}) y_i - \lambda log(c)\\\text{where} \quad p_i' = c \cdot p_i + (1-c) y_i\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Parameters

  • lmbda – \(\lambda\) used to balance terms

  • eps – Clipping value \(\epsilon\) used for numerical stability

See Paper

https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.04865.

Note

  • We implemented clipping for numerical stability.

  • This implementation uses mean reduction for batches.

  • The authors additionally use methods proposed by Enhancing the reliability of out-of-distribution image detection in neural networks

forward(logits, confidence, target) → torch.Tensor¶
Parameters

  • logits – class logits for samples

  • confidence – predicted confidence for samples

  • target – labels for samples (not one-hot encoded)

CACLoss¶

class oodtk.criterion.CACLoss(n_classes, magnitude, lmbda)¶

Class Anchor Clustering Loss from Class Anchor Clustering: a Distance-based Loss for Training Open Set Classifiers

Centers are initialized as unit vectors, scaled by the magnitude.

Parameters

  • n_classes – number of classes, equald number of class centers

  • magnitude – magnitude of class anchors

  • lmbda – weight \(\lambda\) for loss terms

See Paper

https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.02434

See Implementation

https://github.com/dimitymiller/cac-openset/

calculate_distances(embeddings: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
Parameters

embeddings – embeddings of samples

Returns

squared euclidean distance of embeddings to anchors

property centers¶

Class centers, a.k.a. Anchors

forward(embedding, target) → torch.Tensor¶
Parameters

  • embedding – embeddings of samples

  • target – labels for samples

predict(embeddings: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶

Make class membership predictions

Parameters

embeddings – embeddings of samples

oodtk.criterion.cac.rejection_score(distance)¶

Rejection score used by the CAC loss

Parameters

distance –

Returns

IILoss¶

class oodtk.criterion.IILoss(n_classes, n_embedding, **kwargs)¶

II Loss function from Learning a neural network based representation for open set recognition.

Parameters

  • n_classes – number of classes

  • n_embedding – embedding dimensionality

See Paper

https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.04365.pdf

See Implementation

https://github.com/shrtCKT/opennet

Note

  • We added running centers for online class center estimation

  • The device of the given embedding will be used as device for all calculations.

Warning

  • Hassen et al. report that batch-norm bounds the output in a hypercube and thus limits the spread of distances, however, we could not reproduce this behavior in our experiments.

forward(embeddings, target) → torch.Tensor¶
Parameters

  • embeddings – embeddings of samples

  • target – label of samples

CenterLoss¶

class oodtk.criterion.CenterLoss(n_classes, n_embedding, magnitude=1, fixed=False)¶

Center Loss.

Parameters

  • n_classes – number of classes.

  • n_embedding – feature dimension.

  • magnitude – magnitude of

See Implementation

https://github.com/KaiyangZhou/pytorch-center-loss

See Paper

https://ydwen.github.io/papers/WenECCV16.pdf

forward(x, labels) → torch.Tensor¶
Param

x: feature matrix with shape (batch_size, feat_dim).

Parameters

labels – ground truth labels with shape (batch_size).

TripletLoss¶

class oodtk.criterion.TripletLoss(margin, squared, hard_mining, n_classes, n_embedding)¶

Triplet loss which tracks the running mean of samples for easy predictions

See Implementation

https://github.com/NegatioN/OnlineMiningTripletLoss/blob/master/online_triplet_loss/losses.py

Note

  • We copied this implementation and wrapped in into a Pytorch module. Credits go to github.com/NegatioN.

  • We added running centers for online class center estimation.

  • embedding –

  • target –

OutlierExposureLoss¶

class oodtk.criterion.OutlierExposureLoss(n_classes, lmbda=1)¶

From the paper Deep Anomaly Detection With Outlier Exposure

See Paper

https://arxiv.org/pdf/1812.04606v1.pdf

forward(logits, target) → Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]¶
Parameters

  • logits – logit values of the model

  • target – target label

OpenMax¶

class oodtk.openmax.OpenMax(tailsize=25, alpha=10, euclid_weight=1.0)¶

Implementation of the OpenMax Layer as proposed by Bendale et. al in Towards Open Set Deep Networks.

Parameters

  • tailsize – length of the tail to fit the distribution to

  • alpha – number of class activations to revise

  • euclid_weight – weight for the euclidean distance.

See Paper

https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.06233

See Implementation

https://github.com/abhijitbendale/OSDN

fit(x, y)¶

Fit Openmax layer

Parameters

  • x – class activations/logits for samples

  • y – labels for samples

predict(x) → numpy.ndarray¶

Calculate revised activation vector.

Parameters

x – class activations/logits for samples

Returns

revised activation vector

ODIN¶

oodtk.odin.odin_preprocessing(model: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, criterion, x, y, eps=0.05, temperature=1000)¶
Parameters

  • model – module to backprop through

  • criterion – loss function to use. Original Implementation used NLL

  • x – sample to preprocess

  • y – the label the model predicted for the sample

  • eps – size of the gradient step to take

  • temperature – temperature to use for temperature scaling

Note

In the original implementation, the authors normalized the gradient to the image space. This was not described in the paper, and we have not implemented it.

See implementation

https://github.com/facebookresearch/odin/blob/master/code/calData.py
